Method.Step: Add sugar to a heavy bottomed sauce pan over medium heat.
Continue heating the sugar as it melts, stirring to prevent it from burning. Cover the pan with a lid when not stirring to prevent sugar crystals from forming on the sides of the pan.
Cook the sugar until it begins to bubble and brown, alternately covering and stirring.
Cook the sugar until it becomes amber brown, and it's a fine line line between caramelized and carbonized, so don't turn your back on it.
Remove from heat and stir in butter. Be prepared, it will boil up.
Once the butter is fully mixed in, add the vanilla and heavy cream, stir to blend fully
Allow to cool and use or refrigerate.
